title: Chicken and holy basil stir-fry
description: Gai pad graprow: one of the most popular dishes in Thailand. The chicken can be substituted for pork, beef, squid, shrimp or seafood
author: Rachada Mahamontri

dishes.name: stir fry
steps: Put the [#1|10 clove(s)|sliced|garlic] and [#2|10|sliced|chillies] in a mortar and pound to a rough paste.

Heat a wok until smoking hot then add the [#3|3 tbsp|oil] and swirl to coat the surface. Add the pounded chilli and garlic and stir-fry for 15–20 seconds. Add the [#4|500 g|finely sliced|chicken] and stir-fry for 1–2 minutes, or until most of the chicken has changed colour.

Stir in the [#5|1 tbsp|oyster], [#6|1 tbsp|soy] and [#7|1 tbsp|fish sauces] and add the [#8|1 pinch|pepper], [#9|1|sliced|onion], [#10|2|cut into 3 cm lengths|spring onion] and [#2|2|finely sliced|extra chilli]. Keep stir-frying and when the chicken is just cooked, add the [#13|3 tbsp|chicken stock].
Turn off the heat and toss through the [#11|0.5 bunch(es)|de-stalked|basil leaves]. Transfer to a serving plate.

dishes.name: fried eggs
steps: Wipe out the wok and add the [#3|125 ml|oil]. Crack the eggs into a bowl, then, when the oil is hot, gently pour them into the wok.
Fry the [#12|4|eggs] until golden (they should stick together), then lift out with a slotted spoon and place on top of the chicken stir-fry.
